choices.D: Parameters are global variables which means that every command can use these configurable options in order to run. Arguments are specific to only one command.
choices.B: Parameters are local variables which means that every command can use these configurable options in order to run. Arguments are shared with other commands and must be present for each command.
choices.C: Parameters are local variables which means that every command can use these configurable options in order to run. Arguments are specific to only one command.
choices.A: Parameters are global variables which means that every command can use these configurable options in order to run. Arguments are shared with other commands and must be present for each command.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct option.

questions.question_text: What is the correct definition regarding integration parameters and command arguments?
In which two locations can filters and transformers be used in XSOAR? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A, B seems correct to me.

Selected Answer: AB
A and B are correct
A, B test it on lab. No filter options for incidents fields nor evidence fields. Only under classification and mappings options.

questions.question_text:
An XSOAR Engineer has developed a playbook and would like to contribute it to the XSOAR Marketplace to share with other users.
Which two options are available to the Engineer for contributing to the Marketplace? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Sorry, I revise my answer. It is B and D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
While having a large dataset like A. 3000 Incidents can be beneficial for training a robust model, the specific fields and labels (B and C) are essential for the model to learn and make predictions. D. Incident Type might be relevant in some contexts, but it is not typically a direct input requirement for training a machine learning model.

Selected Answer: BD
Incident Field & Type
It's B & D. In XSOAR click on Settings >> Advanced >> ML Models >> New Model >> and you need to specify the Incident Type and the Incident field which is B,D

questions.question_text: Which two input requirements are needed to train a machine learning model? (Choose two.)
